intro: Quamoclit vulgaris var. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered quamoclit, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its botanical structure supports its role as a nectar source for various pollinators.
